detailed_description.textblock: The empirical use of vancomycin in combination with a broad-spectrum beta-lactam is currently recommended after the initial surgery of prosthetic joint infection (PJI). However, the tolerability of such high-dose intravenous regimens is poorly known. The empirical antimicrobial therapy of PJI is associated with an important rate of adverse, linked with the use of the vancomycin and the piperacillin-tazobactam combination. Some studies suggest to use vancomycin-cefepime, which remains to be evaluated in PJI.
